q: Which of the following manual testing procedures is used to identify coding errors and security issues in an application?

A manual testing procedure detects potential problems in the product design that can affect globalization. It also certifies that code can handle the desired international support without breaking any functionality. 

Which of the following testing procedures is the provided statement referring to?

In manual testing, a process adds known bugs in a program for tracking the rate of detection and removal of the bug. It also allows users to determine the number of faults that are remaining in the program.

Which of the following procedures is the provided statement referring to?
Which of the following manual testing techniques focuses on testing one particular module?
In manual testing, which of the following defects comprises of issues with login functionality?
In manual testing, which of the following statements about the black-box testing procedure is correct?

a.option: In this testing procedure, the tester analyzes the internal architecture of the system as well as the quality of source code on different parameters such as code optimization, code coverage, reusability, etc.
In this testing procedure, the tester must not have any knowledge of the internal architecture or implementation of the system.
In this testing procedure, the tester has partial access to the internal architecture of the system.
